page.title: 17POLICE IN EYEMOUTH
page.content: A{sergeant and five constables take part in a 24 hr.rota system covering the area which includes Eyemouth.At present there are no women members of the Eastern Berwickshire Force.The police have a"Marina",two"Chevette" panda cars and one "Ford Granada"patrol car at their disposal. The police can be contacted from 9 a.m.-5 p.m.at the Eyemouth station.Outside these hours the phone is connected to Regional Headquarters at Hawick.The most common crimes which the police have to deal with are theft and vandalism.The number of police on duty remains the same throughout the year in spite of the fact that the population increases by as much as 2 1/2 thousand in the tourist season.However the system is flexible. Men and vehicles can be drafted in from other areas if needed.
